title: why is cho allowed to do over 1000 true damage and have stack unlimited hp?
body: Who the fuck thought those buffs were a good idea? ghost crawler?

replies.body: The thing about the Cho'Gath infite health thing is after 5 stacks he MUST ult for the kill on champions (and maybe epic monsters can't remember). All this means is you have to show Cho'Gath more respect overall and shouldn't get into range of him when you have low HP and think he has ult up.
Id rather play against a cho with 1mill hp, who ults 1 person for 1k damage, than fight a regular poppy, who hits people with %max hp damage
that 1mill hp chogath would get melted by that poppy

No he wouldn't. Poppy's Q is like what, a 5 second CD? 7% max hp. Thats only 70k hp.

It would take poppy over 30-45 seconds to kill that beast.

Meanwhile, Cho eats Poppy. The end.

1 mil HP Cho hits for 100k true damage with his ult.
Isn't that what the boards are about!
cho'gath reclaims his rightful place as the terror of bronze
He is physically incapable of hitting a good player with Q 90% of the time.

ELO problems.
Not trying to be elitist, it is just a fact: when players suck on unknowable and unbelievable levels, stuff that is not OP gets fed.

I got to witness a mordekaiser go 8/0 by about 12 minutes recently due to a top skarner who simply ran down lane and tried to 1v1 him over and over.
This was due to duoing with a bronze V friend.

That shit never happens in silver/gold, although some almost-as-bad stuff does happen.

For the record, I have also seen a 30-something/0 veigar (in a 20-minute game) while spectating bronze 5. The other team never stopped running towards him and getting oneshot by his Q.

I know a master tier player who played viegar in normals. Had 1400 AP by end game.

Like 30 kills and 400+ farm.

The most I had ever on Veigar was 1800AP.

Granted, the game lasted 78 minutes lul.

Neither team had like any engage, and their entire team pretty much had a QSS xD

It scales 10% of his bonus life. He needs to kill with his ult in order to gain health.

So you would need over 4000 bonus life to get it to do 1k true damage to a player. Games normally end before that.
